website_summaries.verdict: It's not without its shortcomings, but NHL 16 is a significant step in the right direction, laying the groundwork for even more improvement in the future.
pros: NHL 16 gives hockey fans the next best thing to going to a live game, from a broadcast-quality presentation to vastly improved gameplay experience and selection of game modes compared to last year
The On-Ice Trainer is a smart and welcome addition
cons: While gameplay has improved, a handful of frustrations linger
Game styles and difficulty settings could use some refinement and the AI can sometimes feel overpowered
Player positioning is also occasionally off and some button assignments can result in accidental commands

customer_reviews.title: I do think graphics are superior to previous hockey games
customer_reviews.text: Solid NHL EA Sports game. Doesn't stand out significantly from previous NHL games I have played however, the last one I played was 2007 or around there. I do think graphics are superior to previous hockey games, however I also think they have created this at a cost to the ease of gameplay. I plan to try out some of the newer and older ones in the near future and will update this after trying Edit: Graphics are indeed superior to previous editions, and ease of gameplay feels more comfortable and I think this game meets and exceeds previous game standards
customer_reviews.author: Friendly redwood

customer_reviews.title: its a hockey game
customer_reviews.text: as with all sports games you want to feel like you are experiencing the action. this was my first hockey game purchase and wished there was more help available on how to perform certain actions during live play

customer_reviews.title: NHL 16 Review
customer_reviews.text: The offensive gameplay never fails to impress me and meet all expectations. But defensively, EA Sports can't seem to figure out how to make defensive gameplay more realistic. For my own curiousity, I had the opposing team freeze with the puck, while I try to take it away. And without protecting the puck in any way or even skating, I just couldn't get the puck from him. Whether I stick lifted or poke checked. This is what stops the game from being a great NHL game.

Can't quite put my finger on it, but it feels like the enjoyable entertainment value has diminished.

customer_reviews.title: Good game hampered by horrible online experience
customer_reviews.text: Since purchasing this product 4 days ago I have not been able to successfully play online for more an a period without losing connection with EA servers. The game starts to slow down and freeze and then losses connection. Ive tested my connection to the Internet using Speedtest and Network MM on my iPhone 6 and the signal is continuously strong so it's not my network. I've tried playing close to 20 games over the last 4 days and it has not gotten better. Hopefully EA fixes this soon or I'll return it and continue playing NHL 15.

customer_reviews.title: ... reluctant to buy the game due to so many poor reviews. However I do like it alot
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to buy the game due to so many poor reviews. However I do like it alot. the presentation is excellent. I enjoy the game play too. It's different from previous versions I've played but easy to pick up in my opinion. I have not experienced the AI issues like many others have. I find most of my games pretty fair and balanced. Overall I really enjoy it. I do see a lot of room for growth though just comparing it vs the previous games that i've played on the PS3. Mostly I'd like to get that live arena feel that older games had where as this feels more like a tv production.

customer_reviews.title: It's a great hockey game
customer_reviews.text: It's a great hockey game, with incredible graphics. The announcers can get a little repetitive and sometimes say things that make no sense but what video game announcers don't have this issue? I'm not an online gamer and pretty much exclusively use the Be a GM mode and it's entertaining. Goal scoring takes a bit of learning but once you get it you can score in droves. Unfortunately, my defense is porous so I need to score. Turning the difficulty up doesn't so much as increase the level of play so much as decreases your goalie's competence. Other than those frustrations, the game is a solid installment.

There are so many settings and options in the game to make it as real as possible it's fantastic! You have to keep your players happy with play time, positions, and payments or else their moral is down and affects the game! If you're a fan of NHL and have a PS4 this is a MUST buy!

customer_reviews.title: Good Addition to the NHL Series
customer_reviews.text: I have not owned one of the NHL series games in years, so I cannot compare NHL16 to one of the most recent versions. But the game captures everything that you would want if you plan to play through the seasons as a player. There are options to play for one of the minor league affiliates or go directly onto your favorite team. At the default level, it is easy to score. But the games get much more challenging at higher levels.

This game isn't really glitchy, it's just got some proximity issues with goals, icing, offsides, etc. I also don't like when games make your players dumber when you up the difficulty. Seems like a lot fewer passes connect when I up that rather than just having the CPU defenders in better/smarter position to intercept my pass which is how I personally think difficulty should increase.

product_meta.title: NHL 16 - PlayStation 4
product_meta.description: Platform:PlayStation 4| Edition:StandardBuilt with more input from our fans than ever before, NHL 16 steps onto the ice to deliver ways to compete as a team, new features across the most played single-player modes, gameplay innovation at every position and an unrivalled game day atmosphere.
feature_bullets: A Way to Play For Every Hockey Fan - Whether you’re an armchair GM, want to live out your NHL pro fantasy, or build your ultimate dream team, NHL 16 will deliver a single-player game mode for every type of hockey fan. Player Morale adds a new element to Be a GM where you now have to manage player personalities that directly effect on-ice performance. In Be a Pro, your on-ice actions now dictate the type of player you become with an all-new progression system. Finally, the most played mode in the NHL series gets even better with Hockey Ultimate Team: Single Player Seasons.

Unrivaled Game Day Authenticity – NHL 16 brings the game to life with Distinct Team Arena Atmospheres, the most realistic players yet complete with Playoff Beards, and a Story Driven Commentary package to pull you into the energy of the game like never before.

New Ways to Compete as a Team – Hockey is a sport that comes to life in a competitive team-based gameplay experience. Whether it’s through speed, skill, or physicality, every player makes an impact on the ice no matter what position they play or their role on the team. So grab some friends and jump into 6 v. 6 Online Team Play or Online Couch Co-op before joining a team in the reimagined EA SPORTS Hockey League that features specialized player classes resulting in a balanced competitive experience out on the ice.

Complete Control From Every Position – Whether you play as a forward, defenseman or goalie, NHL 16 delivers a balanced gameplay experience that makes every position on the ice meaningful to team success. With gameplay innovation on offense and defense, players have new tools to not only score goals, but to prevent them as well. Precision Skating allows you to make refined movements with your skater in any situation in the offensive or defensive zone and Seamless Pick Pickups give you the ability to quickly control a pass or corral a loose puck giving you more time and control to make your next move.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars253 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
